game

Class GameEnvironmentGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameEnvironmentGUI

  • public class GameEnvironmentGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the manager for the whole application. The main method is called from here. An instance of this class is passed between GUI screens, as info on the team and cities are stored here. The relevant GUI frames are loaded and closed as the user moves through the game.
    Author:
    vsh33 dle70

    • Method Detail

      • getStartTime

        public long getStartTime()
        Gets the time the game was started. Used to calculate how long the user took to play the game.
        Returns:
        startTime long the time the game was started at. The game starts when the hero select screen finishes.

      • setStartTime

        public void setStartTime(long startTime)
        The time the game was started at. Set when the hero select screen is finished.
        Parameters:
        startTime - long the user finishes the hero select screen at.

        public void closeHomeBaseScreen(HomeBaseScreen frame,
                                java.lang.String nextScreen)
        When the home base screen is closed, a string is passed to this function, which determines which screen to open next, corresponding to the 4 map locations.
        Parameters:
        frame - the HomeBaseScreen window to close.
        nextScreen - String the screen to open next.

      • createHero

        public void createHero(Teams team,
                       java.lang.String heroName,
                       java.lang.String type)
        Creates the hero chosen by the user. The user chooses name and type. The villain is added to the team created earlier.
        Parameters:
        team - The team the user is controlling.
        heroName - The name of the hero to be created.
        type - The type of the hero to be created. Each type has its own subclass.

      • createCities

        public void createCities(int cityNumber)
        Generates cities. The number is chosen by the user in the setup screen. An ArrayList is constructed, and the cities added to it.
        Parameters:
        cityNumber - - the city number that gets passed into the villain selection switch
